metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1647 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the RenderWidgetHostImpl::Destroy function in content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_impl.cc in the Navigation implementation in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.108 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu1').
